alert.note: Alert for San Joaquin River Canyon; Upper San Joaquin River (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 5:03AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MADERA COUNTY THROUGH 530 AM PDT... At 502 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Mammouth Mountain, or 11 miles west of Mammoth Lakes, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Devils Postpile, Agnew Pass, Red Meadow Ranger Station, and Green Mtn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: San Joaquin River Canyon; Upper San Joaquin River
